data.title: Lionel Richie: From his days in The Commodores to his solo success
data.meta_description: Lionel Richie started out as a member of the popular group The Commodores, before going solo with hits like 'Dancing On The Ceiling'. Find out about his career right here.
data.text:
He's an icon!

Pop icon Lionel Richie has sold over 90 million records worldwide, and bagged four Grammy Awards - making him one of the biggest-selling pop music artists of all time! Rising to fame as a songwriter and co-lead singer of The Commodores, Lionel led an incredibly successful solo career, which is still ongoing!

His impressive back catalogue includes hits like 'Three Times a Lady' and 'Nightshift' as part of The Commodores, as well as 'Hello', 'Dancing on the Ceiling' and 'All Night Long (All Night)' as a solo artist. Read up on everything Lionel Richie right here on Greatest Hits Radio...

Who is Lionel Richie?

Lionel Richie was born in Tuskagee, Alabama and grew up on the campus of Tuskagee Institute. Music wasn‚Äôt his first love - believe it or not, Lionel Richie accepted a tennis scholarship from the Tuskagee Institute before dropping out in his second year.

He also considered studying divinity with a view to becoming a priest in the Episcopal Church, but that idea was soon knocked on the head as his interest in music grew.

How old is he?

Lionel was born on 20th June 1949, making him currently 75-years-old.

What band was Lionel Richie in?

Lionel Richie joined The Commodores in 1968 as the group‚Äôs singer and saxophonist. Having released their debut album on Atlantic Records, the band moved to Motown where they became The Jackson 5‚Äôs support band.

By the end of the 70s, The Commodores were the label‚Äôs most popular act and had become a regular chart fixture on both sides of the Atlantic. Lionel‚Äôs songwriting prowess was going from strength to strength.

In addition to penning smash hits ‚ÄòEasy‚Äô, ‚ÄòStill‚Äô and the UK Number 1 ‚ÄòThree Times A Lady‚Äô, Lionel Richie had started writing for other artists, most notably country star Kenny Rogers, for whom he wrote the UK Top 20 hit, ‚ÄòLady‚Äô.

If that wasn‚Äôt enough to keep him busy, he also wrote the theme song for the Brooke Shields-starring movie Endless Love, which he recorded as a duet with former Supremes singer Diana Ross. A global hit in 1981, Lionel Richie decided to go solo.

Lionel Richie: Solo career

Having quit The Commodores, Lionel Richie embarked on a highly successful solo career. His first solo single, ‚ÄòTruly‚Äô, went Top 10 in the UK but it was 1983‚Äôs ‚ÄòAll Night Long (All Night)‚Äô that saw Lionel Richie taken to the nation‚Äôs heart as it peaked at Number 2.

Billy Joel‚Äôs wildly popular ‚ÄòUptown Girl‚Äô kept it off the top slot. Interestingly, the video was produced by former Monkees guitarist Mike Nesmith and directed by Bob Rafelson, who‚Äôd created the 60s TV series.

Lionel topped the UK charts a year later with the ballad, ‚ÄòHello‚Äô. Promoted by a now famous video, Lionel played the part of an acting teacher whose seemingly unrequited love for a blind student is returned when she sculpts a likeness of his head.

During the filming of the video, he complained to director Bob Giraldi that the bust didn‚Äôt look much like him. The director turned to Lionel and said: ‚ÄúLionel, she‚Äôs blind. End of subject."

The single‚Äôs parent album, ‚ÄòCan‚Äôt Slow Down‚Äô, won the GRAMMY for Album of the Year in 1984. In the same year, Lionel‚Äôs superstar status was cemented when he performed at the closing ceremony of the Olympic games in Los Angeles.

More UK hit singles followed in the shape of ‚ÄòStuck On You‚Äô, ‚ÄòPenny Lover‚Äô, ‚ÄòSay You, Say Me‚Äô and the ever-popular ‚ÄòDancing On The Ceiling‚Äô.

Did Lionel Richie perform at USA For Africa?

Following the success of Bob Geldof‚Äôs Band Aid campaign to raise money and awareness of the famine in Ethiopia, singer Harry Belafonte decided that an American version was called for. Emulating Geldof‚Äôs tactics, Belafonte called Lionel Richie, Michael Jackson and celebrated producer Quincy Jones to help him out.

Lionel Richie and Michael Jackson wrote the resulting song, ‚ÄòWe Are The World‚Äô, in just a couple of hours. Calling on their music biz pals, 45 singers including Richie, Jackson, Billy Joel, Cyndi Lauper, Bob Dylan, Stevie Wonder, Paul Simon and more congregated at the A & M Recording Studios in LA to record the song.

It topped the US charts in April 1985 and also went to Number 1 in the UK, Australia, Canada and New Zealand among many other countries.

Did Lionel Richie retire?

Lionel Richie entered a state of semi-retirement and, apart from three new tracks in 1992, didn‚Äôt release an album until 1996‚Äôs ‚ÄòLouder Than Words‚Äô, which has been followed by a steady stream of modestly successful albums.

Is Lionel Richie married?

Lionel Richie has been married twice. He married his first wife, Brenda Harvey, in 1975 and they adopted two-year-old Nicole Camille Escovedo in 1983 who was raised as Nicole Richie. The couple divorced in 1993.

Lionel then married Diane Alexander in 1995. Their son, Miles Brockman was born in 1994, and their daughter, Sofia Richie, was born in 1998. However, their marriage ended in 2003.

Where is Lionel Richie now?

Lionel Ritchie is still performing, bringing shows to the UK and Europe in 2023! He is also currently a judge on American Idol, which wrapped its 22nd season in May 2024.

In May 2023, Lionel performed at the Coronation Concert to celebrate the Coronation of King Charles III. He was joined by Take That, Katy Perry and many more.

When is he on tour?

Lionel performed shows in the UK and Europe throughout June and July 2023, after the singer was forced to cancel shows in 2022 due to COVID-19.

Lionel Richie's Las Vegas album

In August 2019, the singer released a new album recorded during his residency in Las Vegas. Lionel's album, 'Hello from Las Vegas', which featured many of his classic hits, including 'Running With The Night' and 'Say You, Say Me'.

The album was released just a few weeks after his former band The Commodores announced they were reuniting. On the 52nd anniversary of the formation of the group, William 'Wak' King, who was the co-founder says he'd been making new music.

He told Billboard: "It's very exciting right now. Everybody's kinda pumped. It's taken a while to get everybody in the frame of mind to get back in the studio, but we've been cutting four tracks and we want to get them completed and figure out what to do with them."

Is Lionel Richie in the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame?

Lionel Richie was announced as one of the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame's 2022 inductees on 4th May 2022. He was inducted with the other shortlisted artists on 5th November at a ceremony held in Los Angeles.

Lionel Richie receives Gershwin Prize

Lionel Richie has been honoured with the Library of Congress' Gershwin Prize for Popular Song, which is an award given to a living musician for their lifetime achievement in promoting a song genre.

Fellow artists and friends of Lionel - Gloria Estefan, Boyz II Men, Chris Stapleton, and Luke Bryan - along with host Anthony Anderson paid tribute to the music legend at a concert. They performed some of his and Commodores biggest hits at DAR Constitution Hall on 9th March.

Past recipients of the award include Paul McCartney, Stevie Wonder, Billy Joel and Carole King.
